member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg
member.summary:
Base class for command-line args, such as commands, arguments and options.
Base class for , and .
This class provides two capabilities. One is the collection of names that identify the arg and the other is additional metadata that can be used by certain frameworks to add more details for an arg.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with one or more names.
member.param: One or more names for the arg. The first name is considered primary.
member.exception: Thrown if the collection is empty.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.AddName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new name for the arg.
member.param: The name.
Indicates whether the name is case-sensitive.
member.returns: An instance to the same , to allow for a fluent syntax.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.HasName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether any of the args' names matches the specified name.
member.param: The name to check against.
member.returns: true, if the specified name matches any of the args' names, otherwise false.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.Name
member.summary: Gets the first name from all the assigned names for this arg. This represents the primary name of the arg.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.AlternateNames
member.summary: Gets all the secondary names for the arg.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.Names
member.summary: Gets the list of all names assigned to the arg.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.AllNames
member.summary: Gets all the names of the arg.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.NamePattern
member.summary:
Gets a valid name pattern to verify names against.
Derived classes can override this to specify different naming rules for certain types of args.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets a string metadata value.
member.param: The name of the metadata value.
member.returns: The string value of the metadata.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a metadata value by name.
member.typeparam: The type of the metadata value.
member.param: The name of the metadata value.
member.returns: The metadata value or the default of T if the value does not exist.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arg.Set``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sets a metadata value by name.
member.typeparam: The type of the metadata value.
member.param: The name of the metadata value.
The value of the metadata to set.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1
member.summary:
Base class for collections of objects derived from .
Collections deriving from this class provide an additional indexer that can retrieve an object my its name. They also prevent duplicate objects from being inserted or set on the collection.
member.typeparam: The specific type of that the collection will hold.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object from the collection given either the name.
member.param: The name of the object to find.
member.returns: The object, if found. Otherwise null.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.ObjectsMatch(`0,`0)
member.summary: Compares two objects for equality. The default behavior is to check if any of their names match, but deriving classes can override this behavior.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true, if the objects are equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.NamesMatch(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified object can be identified by the given name.
member.param: The name to check against.
The object, whose identity to check against the name.
member.returns: true, if the object can be identified by the given name, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.InsertItem(System.Int32,`0)
member.summary: Prevents duplicate objects from being inserted.
member.param: Index to insert the new object.
Object to insert.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.SetItem(System.Int32,`0)
member.summary: Prevents duplicate objects from being set in the collection.
member.param: index to set the new option.
Object to set.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.CheckDuplicates(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified object already exists in the collection.
member.param: The object to check.
The index in the collection at which the object is being inserted.
member.exception: Thrown if the object is already specified in the collection.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Args`1.GetDuplicateErrorMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the error message of the exception that is thrown if a duplicate item is inserted or set in the collection.
member.param: The name of the duplicate item that is being inserted or set in the collection, usually the Name property.
member.returns: The error message string for the exception.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping
member.summary: Specifies how the command-line args are expected to be grouped.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping.DoesNotMatter
member.summary:
Command line parameters grouping does not matter. Options and arguments can be mixed together.
This is the default grouping.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping.OptionsBeforeArguments
member.summary: Options must be specified before arguments in the command line.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping.OptionsAfterArguments
member.summary: Options must be specified after arguments in the command line.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument
member.summary: Represents a non-option command-line parameter.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique name identifying the argument.
Indicates whether the argument is optional.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument.IsOptional
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the argument is optional. Optional arguments can only be specified after all the required arguments.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument.Validators
member.summary: Gets the validators for this argument.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument.ValidateWith(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator[])
member.summary: Specifies one or more validators to validate the argument.
member.param: The validators to use to validate the argument.
member.returns: The same instance of the object to allow for fluent syntax.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arguments
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Arguments.VerifyOptionalArgumentsAtEnd
member.summary: Called whenever an argument is added or set in the collection to verify that optional arguments are specified only after the required ones.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Command.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
This constructor is used internally to create root commands.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Command.Arguments
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects for this command.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Command.Options
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects for this command.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Command.Commands
member.summary: Gets the collection of sub-command objects for this command.

summary.para: This collection adds special behavior to prevent duplicate command names in the collection as well as the ability to retrieve sub-commands based on the correct case-sensitivity.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Config.OverrideBehavior.MergePreferSpecified
member.summary: Merge unique values from config and specified. In case of conflict, ignore the config values.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Config.OverrideBehavior.MergePreferConfig
member.summary: Merge unique values from config and specified. In case of conflict, ignore the specified values.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Config.OverrideBehavior.AlwaysSpecified
member.summary: If available, use only specified values and ignore config values.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Config.OverrideBehavior.AlwaysConfig
member.summary: If available, use only config values and ignore specified values.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Arg_Invalid_name
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Name {0} is not a valid name..

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Arg_No_names_specified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specify at least one name.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Arguments_Duplicate_argument
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Argument named '{0}' already exists in the argument collection..

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Option_MissingPlaceholderInFormatString
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified format string should contain a format placeholder ({0}) to specify where the parameter value is inserted..

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Option_ValidatorIsNull
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Validator at index {0} is null..

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Errors.Option_ValidatorsNotSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specify at least one validator..

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.InvalidNumberOfArguments
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid number of arguments specified.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.InvalidOptionParameterSpecifier
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Option "{0}" should be followed by a colon (:) to specify its parameters.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.InvalidOptionParametersSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid parameter format for option "{0}".

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.InvalidOptionSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid option was specified: "{0}".

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.InvalidParametersSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid parameters specified for option '{0}'.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.OccurenceParameterValueNegative
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Occurence/parameter values cannot be negative.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.OptionAlreadyExists
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An option by the name '{0}' already exists.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.OptionsAfterParameters
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The options should be specified after the arguments.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.OptionsBeforeParameters
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The options should be specified before the arguments.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.RequiredArgumentsDefinedAfterOptional
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot specify required arguments after optional ones.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.RequiredOptionAbsent
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The option "{0}" should be specified.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.RequiredParametersAbsent
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Required parameters absent for option '{0}'.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.TooFewOptions
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The '{0}' option should be specified at least {1} times..

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Messages.TooManyOptions
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The '{0}' option cannot be specified more than {1} times..

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option
member.summary: Represents an options arg.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified identifying names.
member.param: One or more unique names to identify the option. All names added will be not be case-sensitive. In case you require case-sensitive option names, use the overloaded constructor.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified identifying names and specifies whether the names are case sensitive.
member.param: Indicates whether the specified are case sensitive.
One or more unique names to identify the option.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.Usage
member.summary: Gets the various usage options for the option and its parameters, including the minimum and maximum allowed occurrences of the option itself, and also the minimum and maximum allowed number of parameters that can be specified for each occurence.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.Validators
member.summary: Gets the collection of validators that can validate some or all of the option's parameters.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.Formatter
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional delegate that allows a option parameter value to be custom formatted. During parsing, the formatting is performed before any type conversion.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type that the option parameters should be converted to. If a is specified, then it is used to perform the type conversion, otherwise the framework looks for a default string-to-type type converter for the expected type. If a type converter is not found, an exception is thrown during the parsing.
member.remarks: This type applies to all parameters. In case different parameters are to be converted to different types, the conversion must happen outside the ConsoleFx framework.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.TypeConverter
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional converter to convert a string parameter value to the actual .

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.FormatParamsAs(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterFormatter)
member.summary: Assigns a parameter formatter delegate to the option, which can be used to format the option's parameter value.
member.param: Parameter formatter delegate
member.returns: The instance of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter formatter delegate is null.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.FormatParamsAs(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a format string to the option, which will be used to format the option's parameter value.
member.param: The format string, where the first format placeholder ({0}) represents the parameter value.
member.returns: The instance of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the format string is null.
Thrown if the format string does not contain a format placeholder ({0}).

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.ParamsOfType``1(System.Converter{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Specifies the type to convert the option parameters, with an optional custom converter. If a custom converter is not specified, the type's type converter will be used.
member.typeparam: The type to convert the option parameters to.
member.param: Optional custom converter.
member.returns: The instance of the .

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.UsedAs(System.Action{ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage})
member.summary: Specifies the rules of how the option is to be used - minimum and maximum number of occurences, minimum and maximum number of parameters allowed, etc.
member.param: Delegate that is used to specify the option usage rules.
member.returns: The instance of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the specified delegate is null.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.UsedAsFlag(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies that the option is to be used as a flag. If the option is specified, then its value is true, otherwise it is false.
member.param: Indicates whether the option can be specified.
member.returns: The instance of the .

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option.UsedAsSingleParameter(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies that the option is to have only a single parameter. This means that not more than one occurence of the option and only one parameter for the option.
member.param: If true, then the option does not need to be specified.
member.returns: The instance of the .

member.summary: Specifies one or more validators that will be used to validate the option's parameter values.
member.param: One or more validators.
member.returns: The instance of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the specified validators array is null.
Thrown if no validators are specified or if any of the specified validators is null.

member.param: The index of the option parameter to validate.
One or more validators.
member.returns: The instance of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the specified validators array is null.
Thrown if no validators are specified or if any of the specified validators is null.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Options
member.summary: Represents a collection of options. Note: This is not a keyed collection because the key can be one of many names.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterRequirement
member.summary: Specifies whether the parameters for an option are required or not allowed.
member.remarks: There is no such thing as optional parameters.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterRequirement.NotAllowed
member.summary: Parameters are not allowed for the option.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterRequirement.Required
member.summary: The option requires one or more parameters.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterType
member.summary: Specify whether the parameters of an option are repeating or individual

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterType.Repeating
member.summary: The parameters are repeating and have the same meaning

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterType.Individual
member.summary: Each parameter is independent, has its own meaning and is at a specific position

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators
member.summary: Collection of all parameter validators of an option. The collection is grouped by parameter index. A parameter index of -1 indicates validators for all parameters.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators.Add(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator[])
member.summary: Adds one or more validators that apply to all parameters.
member.param: Collection of parameters to add.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators.Add(System.Int32,ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator[])
member.summary: Adds one or more validators that apply to the parameter at the specified parameter index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the parameter to apply the validators to.
Collection of parameters to add.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of validators across all parameter indices.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators.CountOf(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the total number of validators for the parameter at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the parameter to get the validator count.
member.returns: Total number of validators for the parameter at the specified index.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionParameterValidators.GetValidators(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the collection of validators for the parameter at the specified index.
member.param: Index of the parameter to get the validator collection. Use -1 to get the validators for all parameters.
member.returns: The validators for the parameters at the specified index.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRequirement
member.summary: Specifies whether an option is required or optional.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRequirement.Optional
member.summary: The option is optional (this is the default). Sets the option's MinOccurences property to 0 (zero) and MaxOccurences property to 1 (one). However, the MaxOccurence value can be increased, and as long as the MinOccurence value is zero, it will be considered optional.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRequirement.OptionalUnlimited
member.summary: The option is optional. Sets the option's MinOccurences property to 0 and MaxOccurences property to int.MaxValue to indicate unlimited number of occurences.

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRequirement.Required
member.summary: The option is required. Sets the option's MinOccurences and MaxOccurences properties to 1 (one).

member.name: F:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRequirement.RequiredUnlimited
member.summary: The option is required. Sets the option's MinOccurences property to 1 and MaxOccurences property to int.MaxValue to indicate unlimited number of occurences.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage
member.summary: Rules for specifying an option on the command line. This includes number of occurences of the option (defaults: 0 min and 1 max) and number of parameters (default: 0). Additional shortcut properties (, and allow both min and max values to be set for common scenarios.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.MaxOccurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed occurrences of the option.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.MinOccurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowed occurrences of the option.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.ExpectedOccurrences
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected number of occurrences of the property. Shortcut to get/set both min and max occurence values. If min and max values are different, returns null. If set to null, then the defaults of 0 (min) and 1 (max) are set.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.Requirement
member.summary: Gets or sets the option's occurrences based on its requirement.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.MaxParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed number of parameters for the option.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.MinParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowed number of parameters for the option.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.ParameterRequirement
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter occurrences based on its requirement.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.ExpectedParameters
member.summary:
Gets or sets the expected number of parameters for the option.
This is a shortcut to getting and setting the min and max properties to the same value.
If min and max values are different, the getter returns null.
If set to null, then the defaults of 0 (min) and 0 (max) are set.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.SetParametersNotAllowed
member.summary: Disallows parameters for the option.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.SetParametersRequired(System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Enforces that parameters should be specified for an option.
By default, only one parameter is required, but this can be customized by specifying the and parameters.

member.param: The maximum number of option parameters allowed.
The minimum number of option parameters required.
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter is less than zero.
Thrown if the parameter is greater than the parameter.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionUsage.ParameterType
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the parameters of the option are repeating (all have the same meaning) or individual (each is different and can have separate validators).

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Parser.Grouping
member.summary:
Gets or sets how the args should be grouped.
Note: This can be overridden by the parser style at runtime.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Parser.RootCommand
member.summary: Gets the implicit instance that is the root of all commands and args.

member.summary: Parses the given set of tokens based on the rules specified by the , and properties.
member.param: Token strings to parse.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Parser.ResolveOptionParameterValues(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRun)
member.summary: Resolves an 's value based on it's usage details. See the comments on the property for details on how the resolution is done.
member.param: The instance, whose option to resolve.
member.returns: The value of the option.

member.summary: Process the specified arguments by verifying their usage, validating them and executing their handlers.
member.param: The list of specified arguments.
The argument run details.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseResult
member.summary: Represents the results of parsing a set of arguments.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseResult.Arguments
member.summary: Gets the list of specified command line arguments.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseResult.Options
member.summary: Gets the list of specified command line options.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseResult.OptionAs``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Returns the typed value of the specified option.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to return.
member.param: Name of the specified option.
Default value to return if the option is not found.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParserException.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the type of error that occurred so further logic can be applied to handling it. A positive error code denotes a functional error. A negative error code denotes an internal error code, which typically means a bug in the application or framework.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParserStyle
member.summary: Base class that validates the rules for argument grouping.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParserStyle.GetGrouping(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Argument})
member.summary: Allows the parser style to override the preferred grouping based on its rules for the specified options and arguments.
member.param: The preferred grouping.
The list of allowed options.
The list of allowed arguments.
member.returns: The final grouping for the specified options and arguments.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParserStyle.ValidateDefinedOptions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Option})

summary.para: Validate that the defined options are compatible with the parser style.
An exception should be thrown if any option is invalid.
An example of an invalid option is a short name longer than one character for the UNIX style parser.

member.param: List of all the defined options.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParserStyle.IdentifyTokens(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRun},ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ArgGrouping)

summary.para: Identifies all provided tokens as arguments, options and option parameters.
Option and argument validators are not checked in this phase. Only the arg grouping is checked.

member.param: All the specified tokens
All available options. If any of the tokens match, add its details to this parameter.
The expected arg grouping to validate.
member.returns: A collection of all the identified arguments.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseRun
member.summary: Represents the internal state of a single parse execution. This includes the commands, arguments and options that were specified.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseRun.Commands
member.summary:
Gets all specified commands.
Note: We use a instead of the collection here, because we want to avoid the duplicate checks, as commands at different levels can have the same name.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseRun.Arguments
member.summary: Gets all allowed arguments and their values.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseRun.Options
member.summary: Gets all allowed options and details of which are specified.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.ParseRun.Tokens
member.summary: Gets or sets all the specified options and argument tokens after accounting for the commands.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRun.Command
member.summary: Gets the instance to which this option belongs.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.OptionRun.ResolvedValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets the final value of the parameters of the option. The actual type depends on how the option is setup.
If the option allows parameters, then this can be:
a , if more than one parameters are allowed, or
an object of type T, if only one parameter is allowed.
If the option does not allow parameters, then this can be:
an which is the number of times the option is specified (if it allows more than one occurence), or
a which is true if the option was specified otherwise false (if it allows only one occurence).

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder
member.summary: Helper class that is useful for creating objects using inheritance semantics. Simply override the necessary members and then convert to a object using the method or using an implicit cast.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.Name
member.summary: Gets name of the command.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.Description
member.summary: Gets optional description of the command. Useful for usage builders.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.GetArguments
member.summary: Override this method to return the arguments available to this command. Remember that optional arguments must be after required arguments.
member.returns: The arguments available to this command.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.GetOptions
member.summary: Override this method to return the options available to this command.
member.returns: The options available to this command.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.GetCommands
member.summary: Override this method to return the sub-commands available to this command.
member.returns: The sub-commands available to this command.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.ToCommand
member.summary: Creates a instance from this command builder.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder.op_Implicit(ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Programs.CommandBuilder)~ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Command
member.summary: Implicit cast operator to convert a instance to a instance. This means that you can pass a instance to any method that expects a instance; for example when adding sub-commands to a object. For languages that do not support implicit cast operators, use the method.
member.param: The instance.

T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.BooleanValidator
member.summary: Checks whether the parameter value is 'True' or 'False'. The check is not case sensitive.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.CompositeValidator
member.summary: Checks if any one of the specified validators passes.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.CompositeValidator.ValidateAsString(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the parameter value as a string. Converts to the actual type if the validation succeeds and returns that value. This method must be overridden in derived classes.
member.param: The parameter value as a string
member.returns: The parameter value converted to its actual type.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The file '{0}' does not exist or you do not have sufficient permissions to access it..

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.SingleMessageValidator`1
member.summary: Base class for validators that only have one possible type of validation failure. In this case, the class provides an OOTB Message property with a default value that can be changed.
member.typeparam: The actual type of the value being validated.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.SingleMessageValidator`1.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message to be displayed if the validation fails.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.ValidationException
member.summary: Exception thrown as a result of a validation failure.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.ValidationException.ValidatorType
member.summary: Gets type of validator that caused the validation failure.

member.name: P:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.ValidationException.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the parameter value that failed the validation.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator
member.summary: Base class for all validators

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified parameter value and throws an exception if the validation fails.
member.param: The parameter value to validate.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator.ValidationFailed(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Shortcut method for throwing a failed validation exception. Use this from derived classes, instead of throwing the exception directly
member.param: The validation error message
The parameter value that caused the validation to fail
Optional arguments to the message.

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator`1
member.summary: Base class for typed validators; i.e. validators that perform additional validations once the parameter value has been converted to its native type. This class breaks the validation into 2 parts - validation of the string parameter value and validation of the converted typed value.
member.typeparam: The type of the data being validated.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator`1.ValidateAsString(System.String)
member.summary: Validates the parameter value as a string. Converts to the actual type if the validation succeeds and returns that value. This method must be overridden in derived classes.
member.param: The parameter value as a string
member.returns: The parameter value converted to its actual type.

member.name: M:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.Validator`1.ValidateAsActualType(`0,System.String)
member.summary: Once the parameter has been validated as a string, it is converted to its actual type and passed here for additional validations. This is useful for additional validations that can only be performed on the actual typed value.
member.param: The typed parameter value.
The parameter value as a string

member.name: T:ConsoleFx.CmdLineParser.Validators.ValidatorCollection
member.summary: Collection of validator classes
